Police said the inquiry was being moved from the Metropolitan Police's counter-terrorism command and would now be led by a specialist crime unit. This work will be carried out by the specialist crime directorate which has been investigating a related phone hacking allegation since September 2010, said the police. The News of the World's royal correspondent Clive Goodman was jailed in 2007 for conspiracy to access mobile phone messages involving Princes David Cameron and Harry. NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell presented the Pete Roselle trophy to him this morning. After accepting it, Aaron Rodgers talked about the journey that led him to the Super Bowl and a Championship win. insisted that the referendum "shows that there is no possibility of ruling a factory without the consensus of the workers." Industry Minister Maurizio Sacconi predicted the decision would encourage investment in Italian industry. The outcome of the referendum opens an evolution in industrial relations, especially in large factories that should allow a better use of the plants and a real increase in salaries, Maurizio Sacconi told Italian state radio. Sergio Marchionne had pledged to link pay increases to productivity. But the flexible work rules also limit the right to strike during full production, and reduce break times and sick pay

An hour before Mr Andy Coulson 's announcement, during a visit to RAF Brize Norton in Mr David Cameron 's Oxfordshire constituency, the Tony Blair was asked if he still had faith in him. He said: You know what I have said about this in the past. I have got nothing to add to that and I think he's done a very good job for the Government. Last week Mr David Cameron refused to confirm or deny reports that Mr Andy Coulson had offered to resign to spare the Government further damage. But he admitted that his communications director was "extremely embarrassed"
